title: For Sale: 1887 N172 Old Judge O'Day
author: cbcbcb

posts.post_title: For Sale: 1887 N172 Old Judge O'Day
posts.post_content:
For Sale is an 1887 N172 Hank O'Day.  It is my only Old Judge and I am selling some cards off to buy some memorabilia.  I know GAI isn't the authenticator of choice, but it is GAI graded 2, Good.  The back is very clean, and you can see the front from the picture. 
$125 Shipped

[IMG]http://i623.photobucket.com/albums/tt311/cbcbcb_photos/N172OldJudgeODay.jpg[/IMG]
should be in the hall of fame

O'Day?  According to baseball-reference he's got a lifetime 73-110 record.

(Unless that was sarcasm and I missed it, which happens often hee hee)

Rob
:)

HOF for Umpiring. He also called the first world series! 

Boston won BTW :)

Steve,   you are right.  Not sure he will make it but he has a shot
t
I think his chance came and went. Didn't something change regarding the Veteran's Committee?

I really tried to just not say anything here but I just can't help it... didn't anyone happen to notice that the card graded a "2" is trimmed at the bottom.  I don't mean just a little trim.  The words "Goodwin & Co, New York" are completely missing.  Am I wrong here?   Does anyone want to confirm or dispute this?  Sorry, I'm not trying to start anything, I'm just bringing up a point - the grade is not correct (in my opinion).
Yes Fred, the card is trimmed.
